intro: Epidendrum karstenii, commonly known as the Karsten's orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is an epiphytic plant, typically growing on trees or rocks in humid, tropical environments. The plant features long, arching stems with clusters of pendulous, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are usually elliptical and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Epidendrum karstenii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in warm, well-lit conditions with high humidity.
